questions.question: Which of the following is a type of unsupervised learning?
options: Linear Regression
K-means Clustering
Support Vector Machines
Logistic Regression

questions.question: In the context of decision trees, what does the term 'Gini Impurity' measure?
options: The probability of a sample being incorrectly classified
The depth of the decision tree
The number of decision nodes in the tree
The variance of the data in the decision tree
questions.answer: The probability of a sample being incorrectly classified

questions.question: What is the primary advantage of using a Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) for image classification tasks?
options: CNNs automatically extract features from images without requiring manual feature engineering
CNNs are faster than fully connected networks
CNNs work better with small datasets compared to other networks
CNNs can handle time-series data more effectively than Recurrent Neural Networks
questions.answer: CNNs automatically extract features from images without requiring manual feature engineering

questions.question: Which of the following best describes 'reinforcement learning'?
options: A method for supervised learning where the model is trained using labeled data
A learning method where an agent interacts with an environment to maximize a reward signal
A technique for clustering data into distinct groups based on similarity
A process of generating new data points based on existing data
questions.answer: A learning method where an agent interacts with an environment to maximize a reward signal

questions.question: In a neural network, what does an activation function do?
options: It normalizes the input data before feeding it into the network
It determines the output of a neuron by transforming the input
It calculates the loss function during training
It adjusts the weights of the network during backpropagation
questions.answer: It determines the output of a neuron by transforming the input

questions.question: Which of the following statements about overfitting in machine learning is correct?
options: Overfitting occurs when the model generalizes well to new, unseen data
Overfitting is more likely to occur when the model is too simple for the dataset
Overfitting occurs when the model learns too much from the training data, capturing noise and irrelevant details
Overfitting can be prevented by using a smaller training dataset
questions.answer: Overfitting occurs when the model learns too much from the training data, capturing noise and irrelevant details

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'softmax' function in a neural network?
options: To introduce non-linearity into the network
To compute the loss function during training
To normalize the outputs of the network into a probability distribution
To reduce the dimensionality of the input data
questions.answer: To normalize the outputs of the network into a probability distribution

questions.question: Which of the following is a common application of Natural Language Processing (NLP)?
options: Image recognition
Speech recognition
Stock market prediction
Clustering users based on behavior

questions.question: In the context of the k-nearest neighbors (KNN) algorithm, what is the 'distance metric' used for?
options: To find the optimal number of neighbors to use
To measure how similar or different a point is to its neighbors
To initialize the k-values
To compute the weight of each neighbor
questions.answer: To measure how similar or different a point is to its neighbors

questions.question: Which of the following is a challenge when using deep learning models for training on large datasets?
options: Deep learning models require small datasets for effective learning
Training deep learning models can be computationally expensive and time-consuming
Deep learning models can only be trained on text data
Deep learning models perform poorly on high-dimensional data
questions.answer: Training deep learning models can be computationally expensive and time-consuming
